title: Verba (band)
text:
Verba is a Polish band from <a href="Pi%C5%82a">Piła</a> formed in 1997. It originated from the <a href="Pop%20music">Pop music</a> group <a href="%23Squad%20Centralny">Squad Centralny</a>. At first Bartek and Ignacy represented different <a href="Music%20genre">music styles</a> such as (<a href="techno">techno</a>, <a href="house%20music">house</a>, <a href="electro%20music">elektro</a> and <a href="jungle">jungle</a>). Later they became fascinated with <a href="hip-hop">hip-hop</a>, at which point they began composing hip-hop music with <a href="Rap">Rap</a> elements. Bartek took care of composing the songs, while at first Ignacy wrote the lyrics. Later, both of them attended to the lyrics. <a href="rap">rap</a> became a prevailing characteristic of their compositions and <a href="Hip%20hop%20music">hip-hop</a> took second stage.
The band influenced other <a href="Poland">Polish</a> <a href="Rap%20music">rap</a> artists with similar styles like Ascetoholix, Jeden Osiem L, Mezo, Owal and <a href="52%20D%C4%99biec">52 Dębiec</a> some years ago. The first major label album " 'Ósmy marca' " (they also have three demo <a href="CD">CD</a>s 'at account') increased the popularity of the band. Until now the duo has released six <a href="album">album</a>s (<a href="%23Discography">four studio albums</a> and <a href="%23Medleys">two compilations</a>) as well as <a href="%23Singles">nine video clips</a>. They have also won a lot of <a href="%23Awards%20and%20nominations">awards</a>.
History.
Early bands.
The first <a href="Hip%20hop%20music">hip-hop</a> formation was called BRAx2 and would later become Verba. The group began making music in 1997. The <a href="Band%20%28music%29">band</a> included three people: Ignac, Wiktor and Witek. Soon afterwards it transformed to <a href="Band%20%28music%29">group</a> <a href="%23Mechanizm">Mechanizm</a>. This <a href="Band%20%28music%29">band</a> comprised the previous members plus Tylas, Biker and Rynias. They recorded material on two '<a href="Demo%20%28music%29">demos</a>'. After a short time the group disintegrated. The members continued their activity and soon created a new <a href="Hip%20hop%20music">hip-hop</a> <a href="Band%20%28music%29">group</a> <a href="%23Squad%20Centralny">Squad Centralny</a>.
Squad Centralny.
The <a href="Band%20%28music%29">band</a> included Ignac, Tylas and Bartas (as <a href="record%20producer">record producer</a>). They recorded the 'illegal' <a href="CD">CD</a> " 'Squad Centralny. Pierwsze natarcie' " ("Squad Centralny. 1st attack"). After Wiktor had joined them, the group released " 'Drugie Natarcie Squadu Centralnego' " ("2nd attack of Squad Centralny"). It also planned the publication " 'Trzecie Natarcie Squadu Centralnego' " ("3rd attack of Squad Centralny").
After the departure of Tylas and Wiktor (producer of " 'Gangland' "), they changed their name to VerbaFreniX and produced two <a href="video%20clip">video clip</a>s" " 'Chora miłość”" ("Crazy {or ill} love") and "„Wiem jak to jest (RMX)' " ("I know how it is (<a href="Remix">Remix</a>)"). Later the <a href="Duet%20%28music%29">duo</a> adopted the name Verba and began producing <a href="rap">rap</a>.
Awards and nominations.
The band won in the category 'Debiut Roku' ("Debut of the Year") and was also nominated for 'Album Roku' ("Album of the Year") and 'Zespół Roku' ("Band of the Year").
The album 'Dwudziesty pierwszy listopada' won in the category 'Płyta hiphopowa' ("Best Hip Hop Album").
The band came in third in the category 'Zespół/rap' ("<a href="Band%20%28music%29">Band</a>/<a href="Pop%20music">Pop</a>").
Verba won a second prize in the category 'Hip Hop - Polska' ("<a href="Hip%20hop">Hip hop</a> - <a href="Poland">Poland</a>") and the third prize as 'Zespół Roku - Polska' ("Band of the Year").
